p: Across many industries, there were no business continuity plans which left them vulnerable because of a significant reduction in labour market participation. This shows that a lot is still required to mainstream DRM in the daily operations of many businesses, especially amongst SMEs. With each State enforcing the lockdown as they deem fit, there is the likelihood of differential impact across industries and sectors of the economy. However, huge capacity and resilience gaps were obvious across Nigeria’s organisation of resources and manpower across the economy. The lack of organisation and coordination at various levels can be implicated in the lack of widespread testing and the potential for underreporting of cases.
